intro: Hesperanthes scabrella, commonly known as the roughleaf hesperanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a rough texture, which gives it its common name. Hesperanthes scabrella is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
